alert.note: Alert for Chase (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 10 at 5:58PM CDT until May 10 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT FOR WESTERN CHASE COUNTY... At 456 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles south of Lamar, or 15 miles west of Imperial, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...At 448 PM MDT, the public reported golf ball sized hail 14 miles south of Lamar. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Imperial, Lamar, Champion, Crete, Chase and Wanamaker State Wildfire Management Area. This includes Highway 61 between mile markers 41 and 49. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southwestern Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
